channel.title: A Noob Question
channel.description: Basically im fairly experienced with some things however could someone explain client based. What are sprites and what are they actually for and also what are particles. Whats the difference and what do they do.

item.title: A Noob Question
item.dc:creator: @Snackman Snackman
item.description:
@Snackman wrote:

if you’re using a 317 client:

  • find the sprite you want to change -> for example, MODICONS 0 (mod crown)
  • change the name of your custom sprite to EXACTLY the same name AND file type as the original.
  • change the mod crown to urs.
  • compile the client and start it, and play with your custom mod crown
    (can be used for every sprite)
    in the client folder, there’s a folder called “sprites”, in there are all the sprites you CAN change, but for some of them, like the ‘decoration’ around the minimap, I won’t change that, because the chance people will f*ck that up is great…

If you have any more questions, I can help you out

Read full topic

item.title: A Noob Question
item.dc:creator: @nathanrr44 nathanrr44
item.description:
@nathanrr44 wrote:

how would you change a sprite for example if you had old sprites and you wanted to replace them with the new ones?

Read full topic

item.title: A Noob Question
item.dc:creator: @Snackman Snackman
item.description:
@Snackman wrote:

Sprites are simply pictures.

‘:D’ is a sprite.
The mod and admin crown ingame are sprites.
The pictures of each skill are sprites, etc…

I don’t know particles I’m sorry for that

The client-sided fact of sprites, is that they can be changed inside the client, in 317 that’s really easy to do, as there is a “sprites” folder in 317 clients. In 508 clients, there are special clients in which you can change SOME of the sprites.

If this helped you out, please tell me I’m new to helping people here, I am not a professional coder myself either

Read full topic
